se.westpay.posapplib

Class CardPaymentData

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.westpay.posapplib.PaymentData
      • se.westpay.posapplib.CardPaymentData

  • public class CardPaymentData
extends PaymentData
    The CardPaymentData class contains data about the payment card that was used in a transaction.

      • getEmvData

        public EmvData getEmvData()
        Get EMV data.
        Returns:
        EMV data from the card. This is applies for cards that have EMV data:
        • Cards inserted and read in the chip reader.
        • Contactless cards that are tapped to the terminal.
        Note! There are contactless cards that does not contain EMV data, but they are not common in Europe. They are more common in North America (which means tourists might have them).

      • setEmvData

        public void setEmvData(EmvData value)
        Parameters:
        value - The EMV data of the card.

      • getIsContactless

      • getCardNumberAlias

        public java.lang.String getCardNumberAlias()
        Returns:
        The card number alias (CNA). The CNA is a number that can be used to identify a card holder. The CNA is derived from the card number but has been obfuscated in such a way that it is not considered sensitive by the PCI standards.

        The CNA is a string of hexadecimal digits, representing binary data.

        Note! The terminal must be configured to calculate the CNA. If it is not, then this property will be empty. Contact your Westpay representative if you require access to this data.

      • setCardNumberAlias

        public void setCardNumberAlias(java.lang.String cardNumberAlias)
        Parameters:
        cardNumberAlias - Sets the card number alias (CNA).

      • getLoyaltyId

        public java.lang.String getLoyaltyId()
        Returns:
        The loyalty id that has been registered, if any. The loyalty id is only set if a loyalty card has been registered during the transaction. If no loyalty has been registered, then this returns an empty string.

        If loyalty has been registered, then this returns a string that is divided into two parts: a name and an id. The parts are separated by an equal sign. The name is the name of the loyalty card/application. The id is the specific loyalty account from the card.

        An example could be "S-BONUS=123456789123456"

        Note that an EMV based loyalty application like S-BONUS can only appear hear if it has been activated for the transaction in TransactionRequest.setLoyaltyApplications(String[]).

        Since:
        Version 1.7. Requires Westpay Payment Application 2.0.11, or later.
        See Also:
        VerifyCardData#getLoyaltyId()

      • setLoyaltyId

        public void setLoyaltyId(java.lang.String loyaltyId)
        Parameters:
        loyaltyId - Sets the loyalty id.
